info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Laurens, southeastern Greenville, east central Anderson and northeastern Abbeville Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Laurens, or 8 miles north of Ware Shoals, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Honea Path, Donalds, Shoals Junction, Ware Shoals, Princeton and Hickory Tavern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
